title: Isolate the Quadratic Term and Make Its Coefficient One
text: We add $$72$$ to both sides to get $$x^2$$ by itself which gives $$x^2=72$$. Since the coefficient of $$x^2$$ is $$1$$ already, we do not need to take extra step.

title: Use Square root Property
text: The square root property: if $$x^2$$ $$=$$ k, then $$x$$ $$=$$ $$\sqrt{k}$$, or $$x$$ $$=$$ $$-\sqrt{k}$$. $$x^2=72$$, we can take square root both sides and get $$x=\sqrt{72}$$ or $$x=-\sqrt{72}$$.

title: Simplify the Radical
speech: Simplify  minus the square root of 72 .

title: Final Answer
text: Therefore, $$x^2-72$$ $$=$$ $$0$$ has two solutions which are $$x=-6\sqrt{2}$$ and $$x=6\sqrt{2}$$.
